question: A 19
sols_html:
\[\begin{aligned} \displaystyle \frac{u}{z} = \frac{4-2i}{-1+3i} \cdot \frac{-1-3i}{-1-3i} = \frac{(4-2i)(-1-3i)}{1+9}\end{aligned}\]

Continuing with the simplification, we have

\[\begin{aligned} \frac{u}{z} = \frac{-4 -6 + (-12+2)i}{10} = \frac{-10 -10i}{10} = -1-i\end{aligned}\]
sols_raw:
:<math>\displaystyle
\frac{u}{z} = \frac{4-2i}{-1+3i} \cdot \frac{-1-3i}{-1-3i} = \frac{(4-2i)(-1-3i)}{1+9}
</math>

Continuing with the simplification, we have

:<math>
\frac{u}{z} = \frac{-4 -6 + (-12+2)i}{10} = \frac{-10 -10i}{10} = -1-i
</math>
statement_html:
For questions A17-A19 below, \(u\) and \(z\) are the complex numbers given below:

\[\begin{aligned} u &= 4-2i \\ z &= -1+3i \end{aligned}\]

A19: Evaluate \(u/z\). Put your answer in the form \(a+ib\) where \(a\) and \(b\) are real numbers.
statement_latex:
For questions \textbf{A17-A19} below, $u$ and $z$ are the complex
numbers given below:

\begin{align*}
u &= 4-2i \\ z &= -1+3i 
\end{align*}

\textbf{A19:} Evaluate $u/z$. Put your answer in the form $a+ib$ where
$a$ and $b$ are real numbers.
statement_raw:
For questions '''A17-A19''' below, <math>u</math> and <math>z</math> are the complex numbers given below:

<math> \begin{align} u &= 4-2i \\ z &= -1+3i \end{align} </math>

'''A19:''' Evaluate <math>u/z</math>. Put your answer in the form <math>a+ib</math> where <math>a</math> and <math>b</math> are real numbers.
